translation.text: Meditating in remembrance on the Guru, all the sins are erased.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

author.author: Guru Arjan Dev
author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

text: ਗੁਰੁ ਸਿਮਰਤ ਜਮ ਸੰਗਿ ਨ ਫਾਸਹਿ ॥

translation.text: Meditating in remembrance on the Guru, one is not strangled by the noose of Death.

transliteration.text: gur simarat jam sang n phāsah .

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

text: ਗੁਰੁ ਸਿਮਰਤ ਮਨੁ ਨਿਰਮਲੁ ਹੋਵੈ ਗੁਰੁ ਕਾਟੇ ਅਪਮਾਨਾ ਹੇ ॥੨॥

translation.text: Meditating in remembrance on the Guru, the mind becomes immaculate; the Guru eliminates egotistical pride. ||2||

transliteration.text: gur simarat man niramal hōvai gur kātē apamānā hē .2.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

text: ਗੁਰ ਕਾ ਸੇਵਕੁ ਨਰਕਿ ਨ ਜਾਏ ॥

translation.text: The Guru's servant is not consigned to hell.

transliteration.text: gur kā sēvak narak n jāē .

translation.text: The Guru's servant meditates on the Supreme Lord God.

text: ਗੁਰ ਕਾ ਸੇਵਕੁ ਸਾਧਸੰਗੁ ਪਾਏ ਗੁਰੁ ਕਰਦਾ ਨਿਤ ਜੀਅ ਦਾਨਾ ਹੇ ॥੩॥

translation.text: The Guru's servant joins the Saadh Sangat, the Company of the Holy; the Guru ever gives the life of the soul. ||3||

transliteration.text: gur kā sēvak sādhasang pāē gur karadā nit jī dānā hē .3.

text: ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਭੇਟਿ ਹਰਿ ਜਸੁ ਮੁਖਿ ਭਣੀਐ ॥

translation.text: Meeting with the True Guru, one chants the Lord's Praises.

transliteration.text: satigur bhēt har jas mukh bhanīai .

text: ਕਲਿ ਕਲੇਸ ਮਿਟਾਏ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਹਰਿ ਦਰਗਹ ਦੇਵੈ ਮਾਨਾਂ ਹੇ ॥੪॥

translation.text: The True Guru eradicates sorrow and suffering, and bestows honor in the Court of the Lord. ||4||

transliteration.text: kal kalēs mitāē satigur har daragah dēvai mānānh hē .4.

translation.text: The Guru has revealed the inaccessible and unfathomable Lord.

text: ਗੁਰ ਸੇਵਕ ਕਉ ਬਿਘਨੁ ਨ ਭਗਤੀ ਹਰਿ ਪੂਰ ਦ੍ਰਿੜ੍ਹਾਇਆ ਗਿਆਨਾਂ ਹੇ ॥੫॥

translation.text: No obstacles stand in the way of devotion to the Lord, for one who serves the Guru. The Guru implants perfect spiritual wisdom. ||5||

transliteration.text: gur sēvak kau bighan n bhagatī har pūr drirhāiā giānānh hē .5.

text: ਊਚ ਊਨ ਸਭ ਏਕ ਸਮਾਨਾਂ ਮਨਿ ਲਾਗਾ ਸਹਜਿ ਧਿਆਨਾ ਹੇ ॥੬॥

translation.text: The high and the low are all the same to Him. Focus your mind's meditation intuitively on Him. ||6||

transliteration.text: ūch ūn sabh ēk samānānh man lāgā sahaj dhiānā hē .6.

text: ਸਤੁ ਸੰਤੋਖੁ ਦੀਆ ਗੁਰਿ ਪੂਰੈ ਨਾਮੁ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤੁ ਪੀ ਪਾਨਾਂ ਹੇ ॥੭॥

translation.text: The Perfect Guru bestows truth and contentment; I drink in the Ambrosial Nectar of the Naam, the Name of the Lord. ||7||

transliteration.text: sat santōkh dīā gur pūrai nām anmrit pī pānānh hē .7.

text: ਗੁਰ ਕੀ ਬਾਣੀ ਸਭ ਮਾਹਿ ਸਮਾਣੀ ॥

translation.text: The Word of the Guru's Bani is contained in all.

text: ਜਿਨਿ ਜਿਨਿ ਜਪੀ ਤੇਈ ਸਭਿ ਨਿਸਤ੍ਰੇ ਤਿਨ ਪਾਇਆ ਨਿਹਚਲ ਥਾਨਾਂ ਹੇ ॥੮॥

translation.text: Those who meditate on it, are all emancipated; they attain the eternal and unchanging home. ||8||

transliteration.text: jin jin japī tēī sabh nisatrē tin pāiā nihachal thānānh hē .8.

translation.text: Your humble servants beg for the dust of the feet of the Holy; Nanak is forever a sacrifice to You. ||9||1||4||

text: ਵਰਨੁ ਜਾਤਿ ਚਿਹਨੁ ਨਹੀ ਕੋਈ ਸਭ ਹੁਕਮੇ ਸ੍ਰਿਸਟਿ ਉਪਾਇਦਾ ॥੧॥

translation.text: He has no race or social class, no identifying mark. By the Hukam of His Will, He created the entire universe. ||1||

transliteration.text: varan jāt chihan nahī kōī sabh hukamē srisat upāidā .1.

author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

translation.text: Out of all the 8.4 million species of beings,

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

text: ਇਸੁ ਪਉੜੀ ਤੇ ਜੋ ਨਰੁ ਚੂਕੈ ਸੋ ਆਇ ਜਾਇ ਦੁਖੁ ਪਾਇਦਾ ॥੨॥

translation.text: That human who misses this chance, shall suffer the pains of coming and going in reincarnation. ||2||

transliteration.text: is paurī tē jō nar chūkai sō āi jāi dukh pāidā .2.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. text: ਜਿਸੁ ਆਪਿ ਭੁਲਾਏ ਸੋਈ ਭੂਲੈ ਸੋ ਬੂਝੈ ਜਿਸਹਿ ਬੁਝਾਇਦਾ ॥੩॥

translation.text: He alone is confused, whom the Lord Himself confuses. He alone understands, whom the Lord inspires to understand. ||3||

transliteration.text: jis āp bhulāē sōī bhūlai sō būjhai jisah bujhāidā .3.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. text: ਹਰਖ ਸੋਗ ਕਾ ਨਗਰੁ ਇਹੁ ਕੀਆ ॥

translation.text: This body has been made the village of joy and sorrow.

transliteration.text: harakh sōg kā nagar ih kīā .

text: ਤ੍ਰਿਹਾ ਗੁਣਾ ਤੇ ਰਹੈ ਨਿਰਾਰਾ ਸੋ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੋਭਾ ਪਾਇਦਾ ॥੪॥

translation.text: One who remains untouched by the three qualities, the three gunas - such a Gurmukh is blessed with glory. ||4||

transliteration.text: trihā gunā tē rahai nirārā sō guramukh sōbhā pāidā .4.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. text: ਅਨਿਕ ਕਰਮ ਕੀਏ ਬਹੁਤੇਰੇ ॥ ਜੋ ਕੀਜੈ ਸੋ ਬੰਧਨੁ ਪੈਰੇ ॥

translation.text: You can do anything, but whatever you do, only serves to tie your feet.

transliteration.text: anik karam kīē bahutērē . jō kījai sō bandhan pairē .

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. text: ਕੁਰੁਤਾ ਬੀਜੁ ਬੀਜੇ ਨਹੀ ਜੰਮੈ ਸਭੁ ਲਾਹਾ ਮੂਲੁ ਗਵਾਇਦਾ ॥੫॥

translation.text: The seed which is planted out of season does not sprout, and all one's capital and profits are lost. ||5||

transliteration.text: kurutā bīj bījē nahī janmai sabh lāhā mūl gavāidā .5.
